required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 14, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Vitamin D3 Levels in COVID-19 Outpatients From Western Mexico
clinical_study.official_title: Vitamin D3 Levels in COVID-19 Outpatients From Western Mexico: Clinical Correlation and Effect of Its Supplementation

brief_summary.textblock: The immunomodulatory effects of vitamin D are known to be beneficial in viral infections, it is also known that its deficiency is associated with a worse prognosis of COVID-19. This study aimed to determine the baseline vitamin D serum concentrations in asymptomatic or mildly symptomatic COVID-19 outpatients, as well as to evaluate the effects of supplementation with 10,00 IU/daily of vitamin D3 and its relationship with biochemical parameters and clinical features.

primary_outcome.measure: Baseline levels of serum vitamin D in COVID-19 patients
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate serum levels of 25(OH)D (ng/mL) in patients with covid-19 from western Mexico

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation between D-dimer and vitamin D serum levels in COVID-19 patients
primary_outcome.description: Serum levels of D-dimer (ng/mL) will be measured at baseline and correlated with levels of 25(OH)D (ng/mL) in patients with covid-19 from western Mexico

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation between transferrin and vitamin D serum levels in COVID-19 patients
primary_outcome.description: Serum levels of transferrin (mg/dL) will be measured at baseline and correlated with levels of 25(OH)D (ng/mL) in patients with covid-19 from western Mexico

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation between ferritin and vitamin D serum levels in COVID-19 patients
primary_outcome.description: Serum levels of ferritin (ng/mL) will be measured at baseline and correlated with levels of 25(OH)D (ng/mL) in patients with covid-19 from western Mexico

primary_outcome.measure: Effects of vitamin D3 supplementation on COVID-19 patients
primary_outcome.description: Serum levels of 25(OH)D (ng/mL) will be determined in the intervention group after 14 days of Vitamin D3 supplementation

arm_group.description: Formed by 22 patients that received oral supplementation of 10,000 IU daily for fourteen days of vitamin D3
Formed by 20 patients that did not receive supplementation

intervention.description: Patients received oral supplementation of 10,000 IU daily for fourteen days of vitamin D3

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Intervention group: Patients with positive PCR for COVID-19 of both sexes supplemented with vitamin D
- Control group: Patients with positive PCR for COVID-19 of both sexes
- Both groups: Mexican individuals, after signing the informed consent letter and over 18 years of age.
Exclusion criteria:
• Diseases that compromise the absorption of Vitamin D; Crohn's disease, cystic fibrosis, and celiac disease.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Provost of the University Center of Health Sciences
